item.title: goHELLgo Gou: Tsukiotoshitego announced for PS4, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • Switch

Due out on March 26, 2026 in Japan.

Entergram has announced goHELLgo Gou: Tsukiotoshitego, an enhanced version of goHELLgo: Tsukiotoshiteko. It will launch both physically for PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC on March 26, 2026 in Japan for 9,070 yen.

A Switch and PC-only limited edition will also be available for 29,799 yen, which includes a theme song CD and acrylic stand set (acrylic stands of 13 characters, each approximately 15 centimeters in length). The limited edition merchandise can also be purchased separately without the actual game for 20,900 yen.

Users who already own goHELLgo: Tsukiotoshiteko will be able to buy the new content added in goHELLgo Gou: Tsukiotoshitego via paid downloadable content for 3,278 yen. The base game and downloadable content can also be purchased together as a digital bundle for 8,778 yen.

Here is an overview of the game, via Entergram:

goHELLgo Gou: Tsukiotoshitego is additional content that adds various elements to goHELLgo: Tsukiotoshiteko.

New features in goHELLgo Gou: Tsukiotoshitego include:

  • New Facility and Character – Halfway through the story, you will be able to visit “Kansho,” a facility where disposed dead are sent. The head of this facility is Kenne. She has a rather quirky appearance, but depending on 8246’s actions, you might become close with her… Disposed dead will remain at Kansho for a limited time. During this period, you will be able to stock up on desired dead within Kansho and later retrieve them. By disposing of the dead, you will accumulate “Kansho Stones,” which can be given to Kenne in exchange for upgrades to various systems.
  • New Events for the Main Heroines – If you’ve built a good relationship with the main heroines, new events that bring you even closer to them may occur…!
  • Three New Unique Dead Fall to Hell – Unfortunately, three more dead fall into hell. What will become of them…?

Watch the opening movie below. Visit the official website here.

Opening Movie

item.title: SEGA Football Club Champions 2026 launches January 22, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Smartphone

Free-to-play Football Manager-powered simulation game dated.

Free-to-play Football Manager-powered simulation game SEGA Football Club Champions 2026 will launch for PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 via PlayStation Store, PC via Steam, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play on January 22, 2026, SEGA announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via SEGA:

About

From hometown heroes to world class legends! Bring your team to the top of the world. Give the management a refresh and compete in major European Leagues.

From local football legends to the top of the world!

The beloved soccer club management simulation game from Japan SakaTsuku is here for global players with its latest version! Celebrate 30 years of passion and strategy in this iconic title brought to you by SEGA!

SEGA Football Club Champions 2026 is a game powered by Football Manager, featuring player data from FIFPRO, and allowing you to compete in J League, K League, and more!

Become the manager of your club and bring your team from hometown heroes to global superstars.

Completely free to play all around the world with cross-platform support and cross-play features so you can play anytime, anywhere between mobile, PC, and console.

Key Features

  • Lead Your Local Club to the Top of the World!
    • Build a team where you can recruit the best global football players.
    • Compete in your selected league and rise from the bottom to be the best.
    • Develop facilities and training programs to increase your player potential.
    • Set training programs to shape the player skills.
    • Recruit and nurture young rising players to become global stars.
    • Search the transfer market and spot the best buys.
    • Experience a journey from local beginnings to global greatness together with your team!
  • Deep Strategic Club Management!
    • Shape the future of your club with impactful choices. Decide which players to sign and who you let go.
    • Endless forms of football formations and strategy that you can create to compete against others.
    • Build training facilities, world-class stadiums, and develop your team to be the best.
    • Every move you make shifts the balance of power across the entire league. Your strategy will decide if you rise to the top… or are left behind.
  • Fierce Competition
    • Start with a local team and play your way to compete with the global giants.
    • Challenge other players in PVP mode to see who is the best.
    • Compete in Cup matches and International Cups.
    • Get your name on the Leaderboard and showcase your skill!
  • Real Players, Real Leagues, Real Football!
    • Get global superstars to play for your team.
    • The deeper your knowledge of soccer, the more immersive your experience!

It’s more than just a game—it’s football, shaped by you!

Watch a new set of trailers below.

STARTING POINT: Let’s Make a Club

English

Japanese

STARTING POINT: Local Fame to Global Glory

item.title: Nintendo to acquire Bandai Namco Studios Singapore, will be renamed Nintendo Studios Singapore
item.content:encoded:
• Nintendo

The studio behind Hirogami.

Nintendo has entered into a share transfer agreement with Bandai Namco Studios to acquire shares of Hirogami developer Bandai Namco Studios Singapore for the purpose of strengthening its development structure, the company announced. As a result of this acquisition, Bandai Namco Studios Singapore will become a subsidiary of Nintendo and continue development operations under the new name Nintendo Studios Singapore.

Nintendo describes its rationale for the acquisitions as follows:

Bandai Namco Studios Singapore was established as one of Bandai Namco Group’s overseas bases and is a development company with strong expertise in creating in-game art assets. It has contributed to the development of Nintendo titles, including the Splatoon series, and has an ongoing business relationship with Nintendo.

Considering this business record, Nintendo has made the decision to acquire shares in Bandai Namco Studios Singapore to strengthen the development structure of the Nintendo Group.

Nintendo plans to acquire 80 percent of Bandai Namco Studios Singapore shares on April 1, 2026, with the remaining shares to be acquired after a certain period, once the subsidiary’s operations have stabilized.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/nintendo-to-acquire-bandai-namco-studios-singapore-will-be-renamed-nintendo-studios-singapore
